Contacts API documentation¶

Add your content using reStructuredText syntax. See the reStructuredText documentation for details.

Contacts API main¶

main.launch(app: FastAPI)¶

Connecting the cache to the system for determining limits on the number of requests.

Parameters:

app (FastAPI) – Application object.

async main.root(db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db)) → dict¶

Endpoint for determining application readiness.

Parameters:

db (AsyncSession) – Database connection.

Returns:

Welcome message when ready. Otherwise, an error message is displayed.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

HTTPException – If the connection to the database failed due to invalid accesses being provided or for some other reason (for example, the server is not running).

Contacts API database¶

Bases: DeclarativeBase

metadata: ClassVar[MetaData] = MetaData()¶

Refers to the _schema.MetaData collection that will be used for new _schema.Table objects.

See also

orm_declarative_metadata

registry: ClassVar[_RegistryType] = <sqlalchemy.orm.decl_api.registry object>¶

Refers to the _orm.registry in use where new _orm.Mapper objects will be associated.

async src.database.get_db(db_init=Depends(init_db_once)) → AsyncGenerator[AsyncSession, None]¶

Granting access to a database to execute a single set of queries.

Parameters:

db_init (Any) – Setting up the connection to the database.

Returns:

A session for working with the database.

Return type:

AsyncGenerator[AsyncSession, None]

Raises:

HTTPException – If session creation failed.

async src.database.init_db() → None¶

Creation of tables in the database based on defined entity models.

Raises:

HTTPException – If the tables could not be created.

async src.database.init_db_once() → None¶

Making all the necessary settings, at the beginning of the application, necessary for working with the database.

async src.database.init_engine() → None¶

Establishing a connection to a particular type of database server and checking its capabilities is done before it is requested.

Contacts API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.avatar(email: str, url: str, db: AsyncSession) → Response¶

Setting a link to a user’s avatar.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The e-mail address of the user whose avatar needs to be specified.

  • url (str) – The web address of the image that represents the user’s image.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Database connection.

Returns:

The entity of a particular user if the user was successfully found at the specified email address.

Return type:

Response

async src.repository.users.create(body: UserRequest, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db)) → Response¶

Create a new user based on the provided email address and password.

Parameters:

  • body (UserRequest) – A couple of fields are required to create an entity.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Database connection.

Returns:

The part of the created entity that contains the ID and email address.

Return type:

Response

async src.repository.users.update(user: User, db: AsyncSession, revoke: bool = False) → TokenSchema | None¶

Making changes to one or more fields of an existing user.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – A set of all fields from the user model for the database.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Database connection.

  • revoke (bool) – Indication that the refresh token must be reset.

Returns:

The access and update token and their type if the entity was successfully updated.

Return type:

TokenSchema | None

async src.repository.users.verify(email: str, db: AsyncSession) → None¶

The process of marking a user as one whose email address has been verified.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – Email address of an existing user.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Database connection.

Contacts API service Auth¶

class src.services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

async create_token(email: str, token: Token = None, expire: bool = False) → str¶

Generation of one of the types of tokens where the e-mail address, creation date and expiration date are used as the payload.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email address used as part of the payload.

  • token (Token) – One of two common types of tokens (access token and refresh token) or an empty value for a non-standard token.

  • expire (bool) – True value for specifying the token’s validity period in days, otherwise in minutes.

Returns:

A string representation of the generated token.

Return type:

str

async decode_token(token: str, type: Token = None) → str¶

Extract the email address from the token string representation payload.

Parameters:

  • token (Token) – The token from which you need to get information.

  • token – One of two common types of tokens (access token and refresh token) or an empty value for a non-standard token.

Returns:

The email address is extracted from the token.

Return type:

str

Raises:

HTTPException – If the token cannot be decoded with an incorrect structure or when the type of token specified in the payload is incorrect.

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db)) → Response¶

Get the logged in user.

Parameters:

  • token (str) – The access token by which the user is searched.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Database connection.

Returns:

The entity of the found user.

Return type:

Response

Raises:

HTTPException – If the token type does not match or the user with the email address contained in the token does not exist.

get_password_hash(password: str) → str¶
async get_user_by_email(email: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db)) → Response | None¶

Get a model’s entity based on its email address.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The e-mail address of the owner of which you need to find.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Database connection.

Returns:

The user entity, if one exists, with the specified email address.

Return type:

Response | None

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
verify_password(plain_password: str, hashed_password: str) → bool¶

Checking the correctness of the password.

Parameters:

  • plain_password (str) – Password in the form in which it was entered by the user.

  • hashed_password (str) – Password as it is stored in the database.

Returns:

True if the values ​​passed through the parameters are the same password.

Return type:

bool

class src.services.auth.Token(value, names=<not given>, *values, module=None, qualname=None, type=None, start=1, boundary=None)¶

Bases: Enum

ACCESS = 'access_token'¶
REFRESH = 'refresh_token'¶

Contacts API service E-mail¶

async src.services.email.send(address: EmailStr, subject: str, host: str, type: str) → None¶

Send an email to the specified address.

Parameters:

  • address (EmailStr) – The e-mail address to which the letter should be sent.

  • subject (str) – A brief description of the letter that is used as its header.

  • host (str) – The domain name or IP address from which this application is available. This value is used to substitute in references to application endpoints or its static files.

  • type (str) – The part of the endpoint path or email template name prefix that defines the destination of both.

Contacts API service Environment¶

src.services.environment.environment(name: str = 'POSTGRES_URL', prefix: bool = False, lower: bool = False) → dict | str¶

Reads environment variables.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The full name of the environment variable or its beginning.

  • prefix (bool) – Indicates that the previous parameter is only part of the variable.

  • lower (bool) – Specifies that the result keys should be written in lowercase letters.

Returns:

A set of environment variable values ​​if prefixed or a single environment variable is provided.

Return type:

dict | str
